info.title: Resource Function Activation and Configuration
info.description: Provisioning and lifecycle management of Resource Functions

get.description: This operation list or find ResourceFunction entities

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

X-Result-Count.description: Actual number of items returned in the response body

X-Total-Count.description: Total number of items matching criteria

post.description: This operation creates a ResourceFunction entity.

get.description: This operation retrieves a ResourceFunction entity. Attribute selection is enabled for all first level attributes.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to provide in response

patch.description: This operation updates partially a ResourceFunction entity.

delete.description: This operation deletes a ResourceFunction entity.

post.description: This operation creates a Migrate entity.

get.description: This operation retrieves a Migrate entity. Attribute selection is enabled for all first level attributes.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to provide in response

post.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Data containing the callback endpoint to deliver the information

delete.description: Resets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the registered listener

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

Attachment.description: Complements the description of an element (for instance a product) through video, pictures...

id.description: Unique identifier for this particular attachment

attachmentType.description: Attachment type such as video, picture

content.description: The actual contents of the attachment object, if embedded, encoded as base64

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

mimeType.description: Attachment mime type such as extension file for video, picture and document

name.description: The name of the attachment

url.description: Uniform Resource Locator, is a web page address (a subset of URI)

validFor.description: The period of time for which the attachment is valid

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

AttachmentRef.description: Attachment reference. An attachment complements the description of an element (for instance a product) through video, pictures

href.description: URL serving as reference for the attachment resource

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

name.description: Name of the related entity.

AttachmentRefOrValue.description: An attachment by value or by reference. An attachment complements the description of an element, for example through a document, a video, a picture.

attachmentType.description: Attachment type such as video, picture

content.description: The actual contents of the attachment object, if embedded, encoded as base64

mimeType.description: Attachment mime type such as extension file for video, picture and document

name.description: The name of the attachment

url.description: Uniform Resource Locator, is a web page address (a subset of URI)

validFor.description: The period of time for which the attachment is valid

name.description: Descriptive name for graph edge.

endpoint.description: Resource graph vertices connected by this edge.

name.description: Name of the related entity.

ConstraintRef.description: Constraint reference. The Constraint resource represents a policy/rule applied to an entity or entity spec.

id.description: reference id to the target constraint

href.description: Hyperlink reference to the target constraint

name.description: Name given to the constraint

EndpointRef.description: A vertex in a resource graph.

isRoot.description: Directionality: true when endpoint is a source, false when a sink. If true for all endpoints connectivity is bidirectional. Default is true.

name.description: Name of the related entity.

connectionPoint.description: The connection point (SAP) of the associated resource function (optional).

isBundle.description: True if this is a feature group. Default is false.

isEnabled.description: True if this feature is enabled. Default is true.

name.description: This is the name for the feature.

constraint.description: This is a list of feature constraints.

featureCharacteristic.description: This is a list of Characteristics for a particular feature.

id.description: Unique identifier of the target feature.

name.description: This is the name of the target feature.

relationshipType.description: This is the type of the feature relationship.

validFor.description: The period for which this feature relationship is valid.

HeaderItem.description: An item typically included in a request or response

name.description: The name of the header item, e.g. locale

value.description: The value of the header item, e.g. en-us

Heal.description: Task Resource used to request healing of a Resource Function

id.description: Unique identifier of the Heal task resource

href.description: Reference to the Heal task resource

cause.description: Reason why healing is being requested

degreeOfHealing.description: Indicates the degree of healing required

healAction.description: Exact action to be taken as part of the heal process or a pointer to a script to be run

name.description: Name of the Heal task resource

startTime.description: The time when the heal action needs to commence. This allows a delay to be added

additionalParms.description: Additional parameters to be sent to the heal action as name value pairs

resourceFunction.description: Reference to the Resource Function that needs to be healed

state.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the migrate request.

LogicalResource.description: Logic resource is a type of resource that describes the common set of attributes shared by all concrete logical resources (e.g. TPE, MSISDN, IP Addresses) in the inventory.

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

category.description: Category of the concrete resource, such as: Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

endDate.description: The date till the resource is effective

lifecycleState.description: The life cycle state of the resource

name.description: A string used to give a name to the resource

startDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date from which the resource is effective

value.description: The value of the logical resource, such as: 0044746712345 for an MSISDN

version.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a resource

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

Migrate.description: Task resource used to request migration of the Resource Function

id.description: Unique identifier of the Migrate task resource

href.description: Reference to the Migrate task resource

adminStateModification.description: SubState required before migrate is carried out

cause.description: Reason why migration is being requested

completionMode.description: In what mode is the migrate operation to be performed

name.description: Name of the Migrate task resource

startTime.description: The time when the migration needs to commence. This allows a delay to be added

addConnectionPoint.description: Connection points to be added when function is migrated

characteristics.description: Additional attributes to pass to the migrate operation

removeConnectionPoint.description: Connection points to be removed when function is migrated

resourceFunction.description: Reference to the Resource Function that needs to be migrated

state.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the migrate request.

partyName.description: The name of the engaged party that is linked to the PartyRole object.

RelatedPlaceRefOrValue.description: Related Entity reference. A related place defines a place described by reference or by value linked to a specific entity. The polymorphic attributes @type, @schemaLocation & @referredType are related to the place entity and not the RelatedPlaceRefOrValue class itself

name.description: A user-friendly name for the place, such as [Paris Store], [London Store], [Main Home]

body.description: The body of the request. For example for an HTTP request might contain content of a form .

method.description: The protocol of the request, e.g. http

to.description: The target of the request, e.g. a URL for an HTTP request

header.description: Items included in the header of the request. For example for an HTTP request might contain requested locale, basic authentication.

Resource.description: Resource is an abstract entity that describes the common set of attributes shared by all concrete resources (e.g. TPE, EQUIPMENT) in the inventory.

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type.

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

category.description: Category of the concrete resource. e.g Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

endOperatingDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date till the resource is operating

name.description: A string used to give a name to the resource

resourceVersion.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a resource.

startOperatingDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date from which the resource is operating

administrativeState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

operationalState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

resourceStatus.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

usageState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

ResourceFunction.description: A ResourceFunction is a behavior to transform inputs of any nature into outputs of any nature independently from the way it is provided.

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

category.description: Category of the concrete resource, such as: Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

endDate.description: The date till the resource is effective

functionType.description: A type of the Resource Function as specified by the provider of the API.

lifecycleState.description: The life cycle state of the resource

name.description: A string used to give a name to the resource

priority.description: Priority of the Resource Function. Decides what happens in a contention scenario.

role.description: Role of the Resource Function. Used when Resource Function is a component of a composite Resource Function and the exact role of the service within the composite is not clear from descriptor/location.

startDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date from which the resource is effective

value.description: The value of the logical resource, such as: 0044746712345 for an MSISDN

version.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a resource

autoModification.description: List of the kinds of auto-modifications that are applied to a given network service e.g what can be scaled.

connectionPoint.description: External connection points of the resource function. These are the service access points (SAP) where inputs and outputs of the function are available.

connectivity.description: Internal connectivity of contained resource functions.

schedule.description: This is a reference to a schedule. Allows consumers to schedule modifications to the service at certain times.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

ResourceRefOrValue.description: Resource is an abstract entity that describes the common set of attributes shared by all concrete resources. The polymorphic attributes @type, @schemaLocation & @referredType are related to the Resource entity and not the related ResourceRefOrValue class itself

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type.

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

category.description: Category of the concrete resource. e.g Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

endOperatingDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date till the resource is operating

name.description: A string used to give a name to the resource

resourceVersion.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a resource.

startOperatingDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date from which the resource is operating

administrativeState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

operationalState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

resourceStatus.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

usageState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

ResourceRelationship.description: Linked resources to the one instantiate, such as [bundled] if the resource is a bundle and you want to describe the bundled resources inside this bundle; [reliesOn] if the resource needs another already owned resource to rely on (e.g. an option on an already owned mobile access resource) [targets] or [isTargeted] (depending on the way of expressing the link) for any other kind of links that may be useful

relationshipType.description: Type of the resource relationship, such as [bundled] if the resource is a bundle and you want to describe the bundled resources inside this bundle; [reliesOn] if the resource needs another already owned resource to rely on (eg: an option on an already owned mobile access resource) [targets] or [isTargeted] (depending on the way of expressing the link) for any other kind of links that may be useful

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

ResourceSpecificationRef.description:
Resources are physical or non-physical components (or some combination of these) within an enterprise's infrastructure or inventory. They are typically consumed or used by services (for example a physical port assigned to a service) or contribute to the realization of a Product (for example, a SIM card). They can be drawn from the Application, Computing and Network domains, and include, for example, Network Elements, software, IT systems, content and information, and technology components.
A ResourceSpecification is an abstract base class for representing a generic means for implementing a particular type of Resource. In essence, a ResourceSpecification defines the common attributes and relationships of a set of related Resources, while Resource defines a specific instance that is based on a particular ResourceSpecification.

name.description: Name of the related entity.

body.description: The body of the response. For example for an HTTP response might contain HTML for rendering.

statusCode.description: The status of the response. For example for an HTTP response would be codes such as 200, 400, etc.

header.description: Items included in the header of the response. For example for an HTTP response might contain negotiated locale.

Scale.description: Task Resource used to request scaling of a Resource Function

id.description: Unique identifier of the Scale task resource

href.description: Reference to the Scale task resource

aspectId.description: Scaling aspect is the dimension along which the Resource Function needs to be scaled. The id of the aspect is provided here

name.description: Name of the Scale task resource

numberOfSteps.description: Number of scaling steps in the direction indicated by type of scale

resourceFunction.description: Reference to the Resource Function that needs to be scaled

schedule.description: Schedule for the scale. If not provided then needs to be actioned immediately

state.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the migrate request.

TimePeriod.description: A period of time, either as a deadline (endDateTime only) a startDateTime only, or both

Error.description: Used when an API throws an Error, typically with a HTTP error response-code (3xx, 4xx, 5xx)

code.description: Application relevant detail, defined in the API or a common list.

reason.description: Explanation of the reason for the error which can be shown to a client user.

message.description: More details and corrective actions related to the error which can be shown to a client user.

referenceError.description: URI of documentation describing the error.
